p: Importantly, troponin can be elevated in COVID patients with underlying renal impairment [ 42]. In this setting, elevations of other cardiac biomarkers will be more reliable as an indicator of underlying cardiac injury. Zhou et al. and Li et al. have described increased levels of creatine kinaseâ€“myocardial band (CK-MB), myoglobin, and NT-pro-BNP in COVID patients, which also correlated with the severity of disease [ 50, 51].
